title: Getting Started
description: Learn how to set up and run König Food
content:
# Getting Started

Welcome to König Food! This guide will help you get started with your database-free e-commerce store.

## Prerequisites

- Node.js 18.17 or later
- npm or yarn package manager
- A text editor (VS Code recommended)

## Installation Steps

1. Clone the repository or download the source code
2. Navigate to the project directory
3. Install dependencies: `npm install`
4. Copy `.env.local.example` to `.env.local`
5. Configure your environment variables
6. Run the development server: `npm run dev`
7. Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser

## Next Steps

Once you have König Food running, you can:

- Configure your products in `configs/products.json`
- Customize site settings in `configs/locale.en.json`
- Set up payment providers
- Configure email settings for order notifications

title: Configuration Guide
description: Learn how to configure König Food using JSON files
content:
# Configuration Guide

König Food uses a **config-only customization approach**. All customization is done through JSON files in the `/configs` folder. You never need to modify the application code.

## Configuration Files

### configs/products.json
Defines all products in your store. Each product includes:
- Basic info (ID, Title, Description)
- Pricing (RegularPrice, SalePrice)
- Media (FeaturedImage, Gallery)
- Categories and Tags
- Download URL for virtual products

### configs/locale.en.json
Controls all text content and labels:
- Site name and tagline
- Contact information (phone, address)
- All UI labels and messages
- Navigation menu items

### configs/homepage.json
Controls which sections appear on the homepage:
- Banner visibility
- Recent products (show/hide + count)
- Brand story section
- Testimonials
- Newsletter signup
- Partner brands

### configs/documentation-pages.json
Defines all documentation pages (this documentation system!):
- Page slugs and titles
- Content for each page
- Navigation order

## Why Config-Only?

This approach provides several benefits:

1. **No coding required** - Just edit JSON files
2. **Safe updates** - Never touch application code
3. **Easy backups** - Just backup the configs folder
4. **Version control friendly** - Track your changes easily
5. **Fast customization** - Change content without rebuilding

title: Email Configuration
description: Set up Gmail SMTP for order notifications
content:
# Email Configuration

König Food uses Gmail SMTP to send order confirmation emails to customers and admin notifications.

## Why Gmail?

- **Free**: 500 emails per day at no cost
- **Reliable**: Enterprise-grade delivery
- **Simple**: Only 2 configuration values needed

## Setup Steps

### 1. Enable 2-Factor Authentication

1. Go to [myaccount.google.com](https://myaccount.google.com)
2. Navigate to Security
3. Enable 2-Step Verification

### 2. Generate App Password

1. Go to Security > 2-Step Verification
2. Scroll down to App passwords
3. Select "Mail" and "Other (Custom name)"
4. Enter "König Food" as the name
5. Click Generate
6. Copy the 16-character password

### 3. Configure Environment Variables

Update `.env.local`:

```env
GMAIL_USER=your-email@gmail.com
GMAIL_APP_PASSWORD=xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx
```

## How It Works

- **Customer emails**: Order confirmation with download links
- **Admin emails**: Order notification sent to the same Gmail inbox
- **Contact form**: Submissions sent to your Gmail

## Troubleshooting

If emails aren't sending:

1. Verify 2FA is enabled on your Google account
2. Use an App Password, not your regular Gmail password
3. Check spam/junk folders
4. Review server logs for error messages

title: Customization Options
description: Customize your store appearance and behavior
content:
# Customization Options

## Site Information

Edit `configs/locale.en.json`:

```json
{
  "siteName": "Your Store Name",
  "siteTagline": "Your Store Tagline",
  "phone": "+1 234 567 890",
  "address": "123 Main Street, City"
}
```

## Homepage Sections

Edit `configs/homepage.json` to show/hide sections:

```json
{
  "banner": { "enabled": true },
  "recentProducts": { "enabled": true, "count": 3 },
  "brandStory": { "enabled": true },
  "testimonials": { "enabled": true },
  "newsletter": { "enabled": false },
  "brands": { "enabled": true }
}
```

## Labels and Messages

All UI text is configurable in `configs/locale.en.json` under the `labels` section:

- Button text
- Form labels
- Error messages
- Success messages
- Navigation items

## Styling

König Food uses Tailwind CSS. To customize colors and styling:

1. Edit `tailwind.config.ts` for theme customization
2. Modify component styles directly if needed

## Adding Custom Pages

To add custom static pages:

1. Create a new file in `/app/your-page/page.tsx`
2. Add a link in the navigation (edit Header component)
3. The page is automatically available at `/your-page`

For dynamic content pages (like these docs), use the JSON configuration approach!
